intro: Myrcia crassa, commonly known as Brazilian peppertree or cipó-de-ferro, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are edible for some animals but toxic to others. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Myrcia crassa is also known for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
